meanings.definition: Originating or produced outside of the organism or system.
meanings.sent1: The exogenous pollen was carried by the wind.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study the effects of exogenous factors on plant growth.
meanings.sent3: The exogenous rain shower caught everyone by surprise.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was like an exogenous burst of joy in the room.
meanings.sent5: The exogenous glow of the moon illuminated the night sky.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to a stimulus that comes from outside the body.
meanings.sent1: The exogenous noise from the street disrupted the meeting.
meanings.sent2: Exogenous signals can influence our perception of taste.
meanings.sent3: The exogenous smell of freshly baked bread made everyone hungry.
meanings.sent4: His exogenous touch on her shoulder startled her.
meanings.sent5: The exogenous light entering the room changed the atmosphere.

meanings.definition: Not inherent or innate; derived externally.
meanings.sent1: The exogenous ideas sparked a new wave of creativity.
meanings.sent2: Exogenous influences can shape our beliefs.
meanings.sent3: His exogenous fashion sense always stood out.
meanings.sent4: The exogenous advice she received turned her life around.
meanings.sent5: The exogenous aroma of spices filled the kitchen.
